intro: Carmichaelia torulosa, commonly known as the coastal kowhai, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or gravelly soils. It has compound leaves and produces pods that contain edible seeds. Carmichaelia torulosa plays an important role in the ecological systems of its native habitat.
